MR Wii
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Suggestions for Tecmo: MR Wii
By JamesDH99 on Wednesday, December 23, 2009 - 05:08 pm:

You know what TECMO should do, they should have a MR game
for the Wii that combines all of the MR elements and even some
new ones. Like bring the jobs from MR1 and the training from
MR4, have the EVO adventure mode but not as long as it was in
EVO, have the classic MR gameplay, but combine it with the
battle systems of MR3 and MR4, bring back the monster shops
and the Saucer Stone shops, have the Wii read other CDs and the
Wii games, bring back some of the forgotten monsters like
Doodle and Madillo, bring back Etrenties (Or however you spell
it lol), bring back Support attacks for every monster, bring back
the ability to move and adapt to new places, and bring back
some of the MR2, MR3, and MR EVO locations. They should also
put in new stuff like a Monster Show. It's kinda like a dog show
mixed with the EVO circus time. It's not really for unlocking new
monsters or anything major, but you gain new attacks that you
can't get in the adventure mode like getting a Mocchi to learn
Stretch or getting a Piroro to learn Crown Waltz. Another new
thing will be interacting with your monster. You can call for your
monster in a new week and you can shake the Wii remote to
either praise it or scold it. A new rank would be S+ which would
be the rank after S. Choosing a starter monster (Piroro, Mocchi,
or Suezo) and depending on who you choose will effect the
story. Customize your own breeder like you can do in PBR where
you can customize your trainer. Crossbreeding monsters to learn
Cross Attacks which are attacks that current monsters can learn
like Tiger's lighting or Dragon's fire. Use the Wi-Fi connection to
battle, trade, or even combine monsters with your friends or
other people. And one last thing, have like Exclusive Monsters
which can only be found when you get like a current item in the
game. Well, that's really all I have, the exception of the new
monsters, but I don't think anyone will want to hear about those.
So yeah.
